name: John_Horton_Conway
Education: Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge (BA, MA, PhD)
Known for: ATLAS of Finite Groups Conway chained arrow notation Conway criterion Conway groups Conway notation (knot theory) Conway polyhedron notation Conway's Game of Life Doomsday algorithm Free will theorem Icosians Look-and-say sequence Mathieu groupoid Monstrous moonshine Pinwheel tiling Surreal numbers
Awards: Berwick Prize (1971)  Fellow of the Royal Society (1981) Pólya Prize (1987) Nemmers Prize in Mathematics (1998) Leroy P. Steele Prize (2000)
Doctoral students: Richard Borcherds Adrian Mathias Simon Norton Robert Wilson
